page.title: 09Cragwood
page.content: A very prominent physical feature within our area is a large deciduous wood called{Cragwood}.This wood is situated near the villages of Evenwood and Ramshaw and it is on the northern slope of land leading to the valley or the River Gaunless.There are footpaths leading from the villages to the woods and often people go for walks there and children go to play.Apart from the trees and wildlife to be found in the woods there are also 2 ponds and 2 disused quarries within its boundaries.There also used to be a tip there but it has been disused for many years and is now grassed over.The local schools often visit the woods as part of their projects.Sometimes they tape bird songs but usually they collect leaves and fruit and do bark rubbings or identify the wild flowers growing there.
